SEARCH
Package BinarySearchTreeCLI

Class BinarySearchTree<T extends Comparable<? super T>>

java.lang.Object
BinarySearchTreeCLI.BinarySearchTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the element type stored in this tree; must implement Comparable
public final class BinarySearchTree<T extends Comparable<? super T>> extends Object
An AVL (self-balancing) binary search tree (BST) implementation.

This tree supports creation of a balanced BST, insertion, deletion, and traversals (in-order, pre-order, post-order). After each insertion or deletion, the tree automatically rebalances using the AVL rules so that the height difference (balance factor) of any node is in {-1, 0, 1}.

Notes:

  • Duplicates are ignored (insertion of an existing value has no effect).
  • All operations assume keys are non-null and mutually comparable.

  • Constructor Details

    • BinarySearchTree

      public BinarySearchTree()
      Creates an empty AVL tree.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the tree is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the tree contains no elements; false otherwise

    • add

      public void add(T key)
      Inserts a new key into the tree.

      If the key already exists, the insertion is ignored. The tree will be rebalanced along the insertion path per the AVL rules.

      Parameters:
      key - the key to insert (must be non-null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key is null

    • delete

      public void delete(T key)
      Deletes a key from the tree, if present.

      The tree is rebalanced along the deletion path.

      Parameters:
      key - the key to delete

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T key)
      Determines if the tree contains the given key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to search for
      Returns:
      true if the key is found; false otherwise

    • traverse

      public List<T> traverse(BinarySearchTree.Traversal t)
      Traverses the tree in the specified order and returns the keys as a list.
      Parameters:
      t - the traversal order (in-order, pre-order, or post-order)
      Returns:
      a list of keys in the specified order

    • fromInclusiveRange

      public static BinarySearchTree<Integer> fromInclusiveRange(int minVal, int maxVal)
      Builds a balanced BST containing all integers in the range [minVal, maxVal] inclusive.

      The result is a valid AVL tree because heights are computed bottom-up.

      Parameters:
      minVal - the minimum value in the range
      maxVal - the maximum value in the range
      Returns:
      a new balanced BST containing the range of values
